thread.title: WATCH: Shah Rukh Khan visits Golden Temple with son AbRam - Khaleej Times
thread.title_full: WATCH: Shah Rukh Khan visits Golden Temple with son AbRam - Khaleej Times

title: WATCH: Shah Rukh Khan visits Golden Temple with son AbRam - Khaleej Times
text:
WATCH: Shah Rukh Khan visits Golden Temple with son AbRam IANS /New Delhi Filed on February 1, 2017 | Last updated on February 1, 2017 at 11.53 am Share Vote 
(Picture retrieved from Instagram) The actor and producer were on a promotional trip in Amritsar and took time out to visit Darbar Sahib. Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan on Tuesday visited the Golden Temple here with his younger son AbRam and "Raees" producer Ritesh Sidhwani to seek blessings after the success of their latest release. A video posted by SHAH RUKH KHAN (@shahrukhkhan_photos) on Jan 31, 2017 at 6:36am PST The actor and producer were on a promotional trip in Amritsar and took time out to visit Darbar Sahib. Shah Rukh even tweeted an image with AbRam. They were both dressed in black and covered their head using an orange cloth. A photo posted by Monika Lang (@kiran004srkfan) on Jan 31, 2017 at 10:46am PST The actor wrote: "At the Sri Darbar Sahib. Peace and love and all feelings beautiful. Thank you Amritsar." The visit was a personal outing undertaken by them to express their gratitude for the appreciation garnered by their movie, said a statement issued on behalf of the makers. A photo posted by ? Blog about Queen design ? (@gauri_khan8) on Jan 31, 2017 at 5:59pm PST Of his experience, Shah Rukh said: "The peace and serenity one derives at Darbar Sahib is something I feel you can attain nowhere in this world. A photo posted by ? Roma Israni ? Jungllý Billý (@srk_z_junglly_billy) on Jan 31, 2017 at 9:19am PST "I would firstly like to express my gratitude to Darbar Sahib for the reception of our film." The visit also proved to be a first time experience for AbRam and Excel Entertainment's Sidhwani. Before entering the Golden Temple, Shah Rukh said: "It is the first time that Ritesh and my little son AbRam will be visiting the Golden Temple. It was my wife who sent AbRam along with me to seek blessings. I am very happy to be here." "Raees", which also features Nawazuddin Siddiqui and Mahira Khan, has been getting a good response at the box office. Share
